meanings.definition: Refused to participate in or support
meanings.sent1: The students boycotted the cafeteria food to show they didn't like it.
meanings.sent2: The workers boycotted the company's products to demand better working conditions.
meanings.sent3: The teddy bear boycotted the tea party because it didn't like the tea.
meanings.sent4: The flowers boycotted the sunlight, preferring the shade instead.
meanings.sent5: The cat boycotted the new brand of food, turning its nose up at the bowl.

meanings.definition: Avoided or shunned as a form of protest
meanings.sent1: The team boycotted the tournament in protest of unfair rules.
meanings.sent2: She boycotted the store because of their unethical practices.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel boycotted the park after a bad experience with a bird.
meanings.sent4: The clouds boycotted the sky, causing a sudden darkness.
meanings.sent5: He boycotted the party, choosing to stay home and read instead.
